titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Osvaldo Saratsola Cinema of Uruguay Collection M1505
titlestmt.author: Franz Kunst

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-11-29 16:24:27 -0800.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Osvaldo Saratsola cinema of Uruguay collection
did.abstract: Research material on cinema and theaters of Uruguay from the collection of film historian and author Osvaldo Saratsola.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Research material including photographs and programs concerning the history of cinema and theaters in Montevideo, Uruguay from the collection of historian and author Osvaldo Saratsola (1943-2003). Saratsola's research was posthumously published in 2005 as the book "Funci√≥n completa, por favor: un siglo de cine en Montevideo" (https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/6715294). Saratsola also used these files to create Cinestrenos (http://www.uruguaytotal.com/estrenos/), a database of film premieres in Montevideo beginning in 1929. Saratsola was also active in film clubs including Cine Club del Uruguay, Cinemateca Uruguaya, and Cine Universitario del Uruguay, and there are programs and magazines from those groups. Note that the collection's focus is primarily on foreign films in Uruguay and the theaters in which they were screened, rather than Uruguayan or even South American film making.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Osvaldo Saratsola Cinema of Uruguay Collection (M1505). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Captioned 6x8 copy prints depicting interiors & exteriors, marquees, promotional displays & appearances, audiences, concessions, lobbies, etc. Many contemporary shots of facades.

did.unittitle: Nuevo Flores ; Nuevo 18 ; Nuevo Cine Andes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laser prints of various sizes, some or all copied from other images in collection. Probably used for book.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 6x8 copy prints showing buildings and people related to the Uruguyan cinema industry, especially Bernardo Glucksmann, as well as visiting celebrities including Ana Luisa Peluffo, Tyrone Power, Cesar Romero, and Sammy Davis Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Agustin Lara, Louis Armstrong, Harry Roy, Ballet Ruso Berioska, photos and small handbills for Washington Oreiro y su Orquesta de Jazz, radio announcers for CX8, 16 & 32, promotional vehicle for CX18

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: includes stills of various actors and off-air television shots of Marlene Dietrich

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rudolph Valentino in "El Aguila Solitaria" at Cine Stella D'Italia ; Clark Gable & Vivian Leigh in Lo Que El Viento Se Llevo ("Gone with the Wind") premiere at El Metro

did.unittitle: Estudio Auditorio Cine Arte del Sodre

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Does not appear to duplicate programs in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four unfoldered bound volumes of mostly un-numbered film criticism publications by Cine Universitario del Uruguay (two by Cine Club Nucleo) ; many with color covers but containing all text (in Spanish) with few illustrations or photographs and no advertisements. Some published in conjuction with screenings or festivals sponsored by the group. Articles include Spanish translations of previously published writing. Not bound in chronological order.

list.head: contents
list.item: Filmografias 1. C.U. [title from spine]. Filmografia No.1, December 1958. Tyrone Power -- Filmografia No.2, July 1959. Lon Chaney -- Filmografia No.3, Humprey Jennings -- Filmografia No.4, Decemer 1959. Gerard Philipe -- Cine-Ensayo (Cine Club Nucleo) No.2, February 1960. Gene Kelly -- Filmografia No.7, May 1961. Helmut Kautner -- March 1961. Michaelangelo Antonioni -- Filmografia No.5, February 1960. Luis Garcia Berlanga -- Filmografia No.6, April 1960. Alesandro Ford -- August 1960. Charles Chaplin -- Filmografia, October 1961. Gary Cooper -- July 1960. Robert Bresson -- November 1959. Cine EE.UU De Guerra / Cine Norteamericano - Desde La Guerra -- Cine-Ensayo (Cine Club Nucleo) No.4, October 1960. Erich von Stroheim

Filmografias 2. C.U. [title from spine]. [undated circa 1959] William Wyler -- [undated circa 1962] Rene Clair -- August 1964. David Wark Griffith -- May 1960. Carl Foreman -- March 1960. Max Ophuls -- March 1961. Michaelangelo Antonioni -- October-November 1960. Jiri Trnka -- May 1961. Filmografia No.7, May 1961. Helmut Kautnet
[1] June 1960. La Comedia en el Cine Italiano -- August 1960. Hamlet -- October 1960. Cine Sovietico Moderno -- December 1961. Kane (El Ciudadano) -- [no date]. Festival Decimo Aniversario

[2] May 1961. El Cine Americano y la TV -- January 1960. La Comedia Musical, Stanley Donen -- October 1959. El Gabinete del Dr. Caligari -- October 1959. Andre Malraux y la Cine, L'Espoir -- July 1964. La Terra Trema, Luchino Visconti -- July 1960. Robert Bresson

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Cine Universitario del Uruguay has published various magazines, including "Film" circa 1952-1953: https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/3086385 and "Nuevo Film" circa 1967-1969: https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/3086387

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Stanford also holds a collection of Cinemateca Uruguaya newsletters, 1975-1978 (M0831): https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/4084300

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Cine Club del Uruguay published various magazines held by Stanford, including "Cine Club": https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/3085913 and the later "Cuadernos de Cine Club": https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/3085920

did.unittitle: Margarita Pastor Legnani & Rosario Vico de Pena - Filmografia Uruguaya (edited by Cinemateca Uruguaya & Cine Universario del Uruguay, published by Cine Universario del Uruguay)
MGM del Uruguay press release re: Arthur M. Loew tribute

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full pages of newspaper, many with articles cut out already.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: packet of historical prints of the city of Montevideo. Also contains a reproduction rights notice.
